name: SafeWork Pro - Performance Budgets
description: Performance budgets for the SafeWork Pro application to ensure optimal user experience

page_load.description: Total page load time should be under 2 seconds

api_response.measurement: Time to First Byte (TTFB) for API calls

first_contentful_paint.description: First Contentful Paint should occur within 1.8 seconds

largest_contentful_paint.description: Largest Contentful Paint should occur within 2.5 seconds

first_input_delay.description: First Input Delay should be under 100ms for good interactivity

cumulative_layout_shift.description: Cumulative Layout Shift should be minimal for visual stability

time_to_interactive.description: Page should be fully interactive within 3 seconds

bundle_size.description: JavaScript bundle size should be kept under 250kb (gzipped)

good.description: Performance is excellent - no action needed
good.criteria: All metrics meet or exceed targets

needs_improvement.criteria: One or more metrics are 10-25% over target

poor.description: Performance is poor - immediate action required
poor.criteria: One or more metrics are >25% over target

mobile.note: Field workers often use mobile devices with limited connectivity

desktop.note: Office environments typically have good connectivity

images.responsive: Multiple sizes for different screen densities

css.critical_css: Inline critical CSS for above-the-fold content
css.unused_css: Remove unused CSS with PurgeCSS/Tailwind JIT

fonts.display: font-display: swap for better perceived performance

caching.api_responses: Appropriate cache headers for API responses

tra_creation_form.description: TRA creation form should load quickly for field efficiency

lmra_mobile_execution.description: Mobile LMRA execution must be fast for field workers

dashboard.description: Executive dashboard with charts and data

reports_generation.description: Report generation may take longer due to data processing

lighthouse_ci.note: To be implemented in CI/CD pipeline

bundle_analyzer.note: Configured with @next/bundle-analyzer - run 'npm run build:analyze' to generate reports
